articles.author: Brad Brooks, Jorge Garcia, Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: Hundreds of U.S. Marines arrived in Los Angeles overnight and more were expected on Tuesday under orders from President Donald Trump, who has also activated 4,000 National Guard troops to quell protests despite objections from California Governor Gavin Newsom and other local leaders.
articles.title: Marines arrive in LA under Trump orders as protests spread to other cities

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least five people have been killed in an attack at a school in the Austrian city of Graz and others were injured, Austrian media including tabloid Kronen Zeitung reported on Tuesday.
articles.title: Five killed, others injured in Austrian school attack, media report

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Anastasiia Malenko
articles.description: Russia launched another prolonged drone attack on Ukraine, killing one person and damaging swathes of Kyiv as well as striking a maternity ward in the southern port of Odesa, regional officials said early on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia's latest drone strikes hit Kyiv, maternity ward in Odesa, Ukraine says

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli gunfire killed at least 17 Palestinians and wounded dozens as thousands of displaced people approached anaid distribution site run by a U.S.-backed humanitarian group in central Gaza on Tuesday, local health authorities said.
articles.title: Israeli gunfire kills 17 people near Gaza aid site, health officials say

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Swedish campaigner Greta Thunberg was deported from Israel on Tuesday, the day after the Israeli navy prevented her and a group of fellow pro-Palestinian activists from sailing to Gaza.
articles.title: Greta Thunberg deported from Israel, denounces Gaza 'war crimes'

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday the military would rename bases which were changed after racial justice protests in 2023, including reverting to Fort Lee originally named after Civil War-era Confederate commander Robert E. Lee.
articles.title: US military bases to restore names changed after racial justice protests, Trump says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rioters threw petrol bombs and other missiles at police in the Northern Irish town of Ballymena in the second successive night of disorder that followed a protest over an alleged sexual assault in the town, police and local media said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Northern Irish rioters attack police for second night

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexico eased a ban on chicken shipments from Brazil, setting the restriction now only to products coming from the Brazilian state of Rio Grande do Sul, instead of a previous countrywide ban, Brazil's Agriculture Ministry said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Mexico eases trade ban on Brazilian chicken

articles.author: Leila  Miller, Lucila Sigal
articles.description: Argentina's Supreme Court on Tuesday upheld a guilty verdict that sentenced powerful two-term former President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner to six years in prison for defrauding the state and banned her from public office.
articles.title: Argentina's top court upholds guilty verdict against Kirchner that bans her from office

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's overnight drone attack on Kharkiv killed at least one person and injured another 23, the mayor of the northeastern Ukrainian city said on the Telegram messaging app on Wednesday.
articles.title: One killed, 23 injured in Russia's drone attack on Ukraine's Kharkiv, mayor says
